channel.title: Education
channel.description:
I've changed my life drastically religious-wise and mostly educational-wise. I have received a scholarship last for any college that has the field Science and Technology in it and I am really proud of what I have recieved because I'm still in the 8th grade. When I usually play COD these days, I feel really sad and I have this feeling in my heart as if I'm destroying my future. I have nothing to do really these days studying-wise. So, is there anything that I could do to occupy my time educationally other than wasting my time on my PS3? Or is there a solution for the feeling I have?
Thanks, Seif

item.title: Education
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

Gay topic… Why ask us for your educational help? You clearly attend a school or whatever and your teachers/tutor will obviously know what you should do more then us…

Read full topic

item.title: Education
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

m1lkman:

So how did you get a scholarship in 8th grade?

Most scholarships you have to be in highschool for, but some of them don’t have age restrictions. (I have a book with TONS of scholarships).

Read full topic

item.title: Education
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

I don’t understand these threads… You can’t ask other people what you should do with your own life… Just fill your schedule up whether it be homework, friends, sports, exercise, etc. If you already do those things, find something else to do. This thread is pointless.

Read full topic

item.title: Education
item.dc:creator: @B2300_T4nk B2300 T4nk
item.description:
@B2300_T4nk wrote:

[quote=“frozon566, post:4, topic:441520”]You are still in school? Do your homework and study like you’ve been doing, aside from that

waste as much time as you possibly can doing what makes you happy right now(after school work and studying) because once you’re on your own you are going to wish you had the free time to play ps3.

On another note, if you are just generally depressed, set yourself up an exercise schedule, it gives you confidence and well… its good for you.[/quote]I already do sports: Tennis, Basketball, Swimming, and TaeKwonDo. I used to only play after work and studying, but it emerged to me playing 24/7.

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:5, topic:441520”]bbycakes, wut u been smokin?[/quote]Nothing. I’m 100% serious bro.

Read full topic

item.title: Education
item.dc:creator: @Unleashed_Revolution Unleashed Revolution
item.description:
@Unleashed_Revolution wrote:

You can get a head start on your college education once you’re in highschool and 16. I’m doing it and it is very beneficial… I’m on a grant, and I don’t have to pay anything till I’m out of school. I’m aiming high in the medical field, and money is going to be an issue. Better to get 4 free years out of the way.

Talk to a councilor about DUEL, JOINT, and ACCEL enrollment. They will have papers for you. Depending on your school curriculum, you can take replacement classes instead of attending school at all. I can’t do that but I know several that do and its real sweet considering that they all schedule them all at night. If you do this, I’d look into going into a technical college first… way more relaxed.

Read full topic
